result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Diorio

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on December 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:44 PM Defendant Justin J. Diorio in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Justin J. Diorio.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Atty Hayes received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Stands tands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC.  Bond continues.

1:30 PM Defendant Justin J. Diorio not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Justin J. Diorio.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes advises DE contacted the Clerk of Courts and DE is having car trouble and requests a stay of any warrant.  State requests a warrant and defers to the court for a stay of any warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Bond has previously been forfeited.
Canceled warrant

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Diorio in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Justin J. Diorio.  Court sattes case and appearances.  Atty Hayes requests warrant be quashed and explains nonappearance.  Court quashes warrant and admonishes DE.  Cash bond reinstated.  Court notes she has been provided a written waiver of prelim and questions DE on that document.  DE agrees to waive his right to prelim.  Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Hayes requests ARGN be set out.  Court notes history of warrants in the matter but does set it out.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Hayes has no record to make.  Court states NOH was given.  State requests warrant.   Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Begin bond forfeiture.

Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Atty Dolch explains missed court appearance due to transportation issues.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $50 cash bond.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond.  $50.00 CASH bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
